alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:41AM EST until December 21 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Significant flooding of businesses along Front Street in downtown Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:24 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:24 AM EST Tuesday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
